messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] re: encouraging "stick-to-it"-iveness vs.forcing
messages.messageBody:
http://www.musicaviva.com/cello/index.tpl#solo

Some online cello solo stuff!

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] re: encouraging "stick-to-it"-iveness vs.forcing
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s got to be in bass clef.  That lets out a lot of stuff.  I guess I could play by ear, but I don t like to much. Play along ... da ... continuo ... When
messages.messageBody:
>
> Couldn't you just play from any old music that's in range? Just tunes?
> Dance tunes? Melodies of stuff your kids like from kid-books?

It's got to be in bass clef. That lets out a lot of stuff. I guess I could
play by ear, but I don't like to much.

Play along
> with baroque stuff you have the music for? Or Renaissance stuff with viol
da
> gamba parts? The recorder sonatas which have those WONDERFUL basso
continuo
> parts?

When I was still playing one friend, we did a lot of that, and I loved it,
but she hasn't been into it since last spring. Hopefully she will be again
soon. I know I could probably scare up someone else, but it was so
convenient!
Tia
